required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study for Evaluation of the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Antiviral Activity of UB-421 Subcutaneous Formulation in HIV Infected Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Multi-Dose Study for Evaluation of the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Antiviral Activity of UB-421 Subcutaneous Formulation in HIV Infected Adults

brief_summary.textblock:
UB-421 subcutaneous formulation (UB-421 SC) is developed to provide HIV infected patients a more convenient drug delivery method. UB-421 SC injection, with significantly less injection time than IV infusions and with opportunity of self-administration or administered in general medical setting (in addition to HIV-specific clinic), can provide patient a more convenient option.
This UB-421 SC phase I study will be conducted to investigate short-term safety, pharmacokinetics and anti-viral activity of UB-421 SC at three dose levels in ART-treated aviremic subjects and treatment naive HIV-infected subjects. The current UB-421 SC formulation (125 mg/ml) is at least 10-fold more concentrated than UB-421 IV (10 mg/ml). The highly concentrated formulation makes weekly UB-421 subcutaneous injections feasible. This study will form the basis of UB-421 SC in combination with antiretroviral agents (ARV) for treating HIV infected viremic patients in the future clinical trials.

primary_outcome.description: Numbers and incidence of TEAEs that are ≥ Grade 2 and study treatment related, TEAEs (any grades) by maximum severity, TEAEs by relationship to study treatment, SAEs, TEAEs leading to death, and TEAEs leading to discontinuation of study treatment will be tabulated by dose cohort and will be summarized by system organ class and preferred term for study period (Treatment or Follow-up). The "Division of AIDS (DAIDS) Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events" will be used in this study for all AE severity grading, except skin abnormalities, which will be evaluated according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE).

secondary_outcome.measure: The virologic responses during the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects ever achieving HIV-1 RNA reduction > X log10 copies/mL;

arm_group.description: 500 mg UB-421 SC: Treatment naive subjects
700 mg UB-421 SC: Treatment naive subjects

intervention.description: The UB-421 SC (dB4C7C22-6 mAb) will be supplied at a concentration of 125 mg/mL after reconstitution. Subjects will receive weekly UB-421 SC injections during the 4-week Treatment Period.
